channel.title: Watchlogs on Vocal Cords
channel.description: Recent content in Watchlogs on Vocal Cords

item.title: Baby Driver
item.description: I can imagine the idea for this movie hitting like a full-formed idea as the director was listening to Simon & Garfunkel’s Baby Driver. Good story, all features of a narrative feature. Vibrant soundtrack. Intriguing cinematography (I mean those robbery shots were enthralling). Lilly James is cute and Ansel Elgort. is adorable.

item.title: The Dark Knight Rises
item.description: To be honest, lacked the thrill of the second movie in the trilogy, however, it wasn’t that bad. Anna Hathaway as Selina Kyle was amazing but clearly, Marion Cotillard as Miranda Tate was incredible.

item.title: Dark Season 2
item.description: Twisted and getting slightly overtly complicated. No new concepts were introduced, the main ideas from season 1 put in a different wrapper and mixed with tons of suspenseful music.

item.title: Dark Season 1
item.description: Science Fiction and Thriller. It explores paradoxes like Grandfather paradox, Bootstrap paradox among others. Cannot wait for S02 and S03.

item.title: The Big Short
item.description: A breakdown of the circumstances leading to the 2008 market crash. Essential financial awareness movie.

item.title: 500 Days of Summer
item.description: A good story. But I absolutely hate to think what my destiny/fate holds.

item.title: Pretty in Pink
item.description: Typical John Hughes. I liked it though.

item.title: Memories of Murder
item.description: Another Boon Jong-Ho work. Kept the suspense intact till the very last. Recommended if you liked Parasite.

item.title: The Graduate
item.description: A classic. Few artistic expressions can capture the popular imagination with such fervour that they can change the course of reality. This is one of those movies.

item.title: Scam 1992
item.description: Informative and elegantly produced. My faith in Indian production has been restored considerably. I can revisit this anytime.

item.title: American Beauty
item.description: Interesting and creative.

item.title: Looking for Alaska
item.description: It’s devastatingly painful. Not to mention, John’s eloquent vblogs on yt.

item.title: Hackers
item.description: One peculiar thing about ventures are that they tell us how not to do it.

item.title: One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest
item.description: A very interesting watch. Recommended by a classmate.

item.title: The Map of Tiny Perfect Things
item.description: Just to pass time. You have no idea how depressed I am right now all alone.

item.title: Chhichhore
item.description: I was laughing hard. Probably the only thing I can relate to so badly.

item.title: All The Bright Places
item.description: Felt lazy. Couldn’t read the book. Cried at the end. Awesome soundtrack.

item.title: Gone Girl
item.description: WTF? A twisted thriller.

item.title: Parasite
item.description: It’s a bloody masterpiece.

item.title: Before Midnight
item.description: This is exactly how I wanted it to end and I am satisfied.

item.title: Mean Girls
item.description: Weird one. There is nothing here that will interest me to revisit it in the future. So nah, not my thing. However, murmurs of “Halcyon On and On” by Orbital lit me up in the outro.

item.title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off
item.description: Another one of those weird ones. It was fine but for a running time of 120 minutes, it was a bit of a drag. Will not revisit this.

item.title: Sixteen Candles
item.description: This was a weird one to be honest. I did not like it inspite of the classic status etc. It’s offensive in parts.
